New Records: The White Sox remain tied with the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses in one season
Key Match Events: The White Sox scored a season-high seven runs in one inning
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox need to sweep the Tigers to avoid owning the record for most losses in one season
Post-Match Reflections: The White Sox avoid breaking the all-time loss record for another day
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox are playing to play spoiler in the playoff-hunting Tigers' season
Others: The article mentions Chris Flexen's pitching performance and the fact that the game was played at Guaranteed Rate Field
